SENT.plain: Submucous resection of the nasal septum (SMR) is a relatively simple and frequently performed operation

Yet, its intracranial complications, although rare, can be very serious and include anosmia, visual disturbances, cavernous sinus thrombosis, meningitis, cerebrospinal fluid rhinorrhea, pneumocephalus, subarachnoid hemorrhage, subdural empyema, and brain abscess
This article reviews intracranial complications of SMR, and the pathogenesis and prevention of such complications are discussed
